summary: This bill, the Protecting Rural Seniors’ Access to Care Act (H.R. 1683), aims to prevent the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) from implementing a final rule regarding minimum staffing standards for nursing facilities. It also mandates the establishment of an advisory panel on the nursing home workforce. The panel will include representatives from various healthcare professions and geographic areas, including rural, and will submit reports to Congress and the HHS, assessing workforce issues and providing recommendations.
